Text: Sometimes there's cool \n stuff I've never seen \n before.
Oh nothing, I was just \n kinda curious what \n you're doing.

What I'm doing is 
 protecting the peace! 
 Can't you see the 
 uniform?
But I hope I did the \n right thing leaving \n the job to him.
Like you and that \n black kitty cat.

My brother said he'd 
 handle checking the 
 cargo while I went to 
 get the approval...
My my a lot of \n prey... People came off \n those ships.
So, you think \n we're cool, huh?
Th-Thanks, sounds like \n it can be pretty \n dangerous.

Even merchant vessels 
 returning to their 
 home port need 
 official approval.
I'll just have to direct \n them to drop by my \n establishment.
Very!
R-Right Lisa.

First thing we need to 
 do is get permission to 
 dock from the Port 
 Authority.
Hey, if you don't want \n the camera...
Hmph! What do you want?
Kat, you're free to look \n around town, but don't \n go stirring up trouble.
Trouble? \n Me?
Can you blame 'em? The \n city looks like a blast.
Thanks Syd! \n I can't wait \n to try it out.
Sure! Take it with you \n when you go sightseeing.

I can't help wanting to 
 steer all of those 
 lonely sailors to 
 finding true love.
Step right up for the \n juiciest Lhao skewers in \n all of Jirga Para Lhao.
Banga mothers lock up \n your sons...
Kat, take this.
I love when airboats \n come into the harbour!
We have tons \n of work to do!
Hehe, maybe after I've \n had a chance to look \n around.
So many people carrying \n so many neat things.
The men act like it's a \n pleasure cruise - really \n gets under my skin...
No, no, I want it! \n Gimme, gimme.
You there, little lady. \n How about it, would you \n like to try one?
Thanks, the people in \n Banga will be happy to \n hear that!

Jirga Para Lhao, we'll 
 be here for a while to 
 stock up on fuel and 
 supplies.

Their ore is always 
 top-notch. Everyone 
 agrees it's the best 
 stuff in town.
Cecie, don't forget to \n run inventory.
We didn't come here to \n have fun, you know?
Hey, did you just come \n in with the Banga fleet?
You need to be careful \n in the city.
You're full of \n surprises.
Pickpockets and thieves \n are everywhere.
I'm handy like that.
It drifted in with \n one of the storms. \n I fixed it up.
Phew, it's been ages \n since coming to port. \n Tonight's gonna be-
Hmm, must be this \n city's version of the \n police...
A camera? \n Where'd you get it?

Something tells me he's 
 already taken an 
 inventory of the night 
 life around here...
Wow, a whole new city to explore!
Syd: \n Hold on!
That's Jirga Para Lhao? It's huge!
I should take the camera and go have a look around!
Ever since we got sucked \n up by that gravity storm \n in Hekseville...
We've been stuck working \n the mines for the Banga \n Settlement.
It'll be nice to \n venture out someplace \n new for a change!
Could be trouble out \n there waiting for us.
Not to mention we \n still don't know \n where Raven is...
And we have no way of \n getting back home to \n Hekseville.
Yeah...
Hey, look over there. \n You see that!?
What? \n Where?
Okay, I'll check next door then!
No... \n They have to be there. \n I must've lost count.
Six... \n Seven...
Eight!
Nine...
Wait!
Now there's more? \n That's impossible...
Huh?
Hey! \n What do you think \n you're doing!?
Can't you see \n I'm busy?
Isn't that the \n ore I busted my \n butt to collect?
After all my hard work, \n I wanna know where \n you're taking it.
This is the last \n thing I needed!
Maybe if I \n count one \n more time...
Vogo!
Vogo Sun.
What's taking \n so long?

Oh! 
 I'm just going over the 
 delivery one last time. 
 I'll be done in a jiffy, I swear.
Hmph. \n You'd better be.
If you're late, there \n are plenty of traders \n who can take your place.
Of course!
*Sigh*
I don't get it, \n how'd they \n go missing?
What do I do...
How'd what \n go missing?
Well uhm...
Alright, if you \n promise to keep \n it a secret...
Okay!
WHAAAT!?
So there's \n ore missing?
Exactly!
She didn't waste \n time ratting me out.
I double-checked \n when I heard the \n news...

I'm sorry Vogo, 
 I should've been 
 there to guard 
 them.
This doesn't just \n hurt Sun Shipping...
It could affect our \n tribe's livelihood.
Everyone, check \n this out.
When we came into \n port, I took this \n picture.
Hmm...
Fi, do you know \n who they are?
Yes.
The Angry Centipede are \n behind our missing cargo.
Airboats comin' into port, prepare the ropes!
That's it, bring her in nice and slow.
Some people have it hard...
Okay, better head to the bar.
Use the Picture and \n Ask Around for Clues
So this is the market, huh. Guess I'll look around here.
Okay, where's that store...
I know, I should ask one of the store owners.
Maybe I should just check in with the store owners.
Ask Around the Stores \n in the Plaza Fountain
I need to ask the store owners about the Angry Centipede.

The Angry Centipede are 
 a group of bandits 
 plaguing the area around 
 the harbour.

You'll know them by that 
 centipede mark they have 
 somewhere on their 
 clothing.

Can you believe it! They 
 had to go and hit the 
 cargo bound for the 
 Council!
I'm sorry, I should've \n stayed on guard duty. If \n I had-
Fi, what's past is past. \n There's no use wasting \n time thinking about it.
Better to think of a way \n to get that cargo back, \n right?
Right! You're right!
Vogo sure seems eager \n to move on past his \n mistake...
How do we get it back?

We could start by asking 
 about any suspicious 
 characters wearing 
 Centipede clothing.
Let's split up and see \n what we can find out.
Kat, take this.
Got it!
That picture should help \n with finding the Angry \n Centipede.
Right!
Seen anyone wearing this logo?
There's no point asking \n me about the Angry \n Centipede.
What are you doing, \n anyway?
I'm standing guard. \n Someone needs to.
Right, just try to do a \n better job of it than \n last time.
Ask around for \n information.
Preferably someone \n other than me.
R-Right, sorry.

Today's the shipping 
 deadline, if we don't 
 give the Council their 
 cargo...
They'll revoke Sun \n Shipping's licence and \n we'll be to blame.
Now get out there and \n find some answers.
You saw them over in the market plaza? Thanks!
Okay, I'll ask someone else.
Yeah I know that mark, \n the Angry Centipede.
That's right! Do you \n know where they are?
Wish I did, they've cost \n me a fortune.
Since then, I've been \n struggling to work off \n the debt I incurred.
I used to have money to \n go out on the town, now \n look at me...
If I hear anything, I'll \n let you know.
Yeah, I know 'em. They \n hang around the \n marketplace sometimes.
I gotta say, that bug \n design they've got is \n wicked cool.
Really? It looks kind of \n icky to me, what with \n all the legs and-
Never mind, where in the \n market did you say you \n saw them?
Around the fountain.
Got it, thanks!
Seen anyone wearing this logo on their jackets?
Hmm, yeah, \n I've seen 'em. \n Even talked to 'em once.
Really, where?

They chatted me up while 
 I was browsing one of 
 the stalls in the 
 market.
They asked me out for a \n drink. I said no, of \n course.
As if I'd hang out with \n some weirdoes wearing \n bugs on their clothes.
Yeah, and gross too with \n all those legs and-
Forget it. You said the \n market right? I better \n check there.
You've seen them hanging around the plaza? Thanks!
Yep, I see 'em hanging \n around my store now and \n again.
Really?
I'm looking for anything \n you can tell me.
Well, while I was \n sipping on a cheap \n cocktail...

I heard 'em complain 
 they were "tired of 
 being in the dark all 
 day".
Lei Elgona's always \n dark. Maybe they live \n down there?
Lei Elgona! Got it. \n Wait, could you tell me \n where that is?
It's at the very bottom \n of Jirga Para Lhao.
Keep going down, you'll \n find it eventually.
It's okay, I'll keep asking...
Hmm, can't be sure if \n I've seen them before or \n not.
Come on... \n You've either seen \n them or you haven't.
I've heard all about \n the rise in theft \n lately...
Oh yeah, there's a rash \n of it over at the \n market.
Probably because the \n Council raised taxes \n again.

But of course, being 
 poor is no excuse for 
 thieving, no excuse at 
 all.
You've got that right!
You're lookin' for these \n guys?
Did they steal \n somethin' again?
Yes! I think they're \n the ones who stole our \n cargo.
I see, I see.
Of course stealing's \n wrong...

But it takes two to 
 tango. Whoever let that 
 cargo out of their sight 
 sounds like a slacker.
Th-That's not-!?
Well, maybe he does \n have a point with \n Vogo...

The thieves are prolly 
 celebratin' their 
 victory with a drink. 
 That's what I'd do.
Have you seen these men before?
Oh them...

Seen 'em hanging 
 around next door. Hard 
 to miss that awful 
 bug on their clothes.
Now I'm getting \n somewhere!
Next door, got it! Thank \n you for the help!

No, sorry, can't say 
 I've seen anyone 
 matching that 
 description.
Oh, that's too bad. \n Thanks anywa-
Wait, is that a \n centipede mark?
Y-Yes, you know it?
I heard about 'em from a \n regular customer.

Sounds like they're 
 making trouble around 
 the harbour and the 
 marketplace.
He called 'em the \n Centipede.
My customer got hit by \n 'em too.
Haven't seen him since.

He promised he would 
 buy me all the fancy 
 jewellery I ever 
 wanted...
Guess when the money \n dries up, promises dry \n up too.
R-Right, I better get \n going then.
I'm sorry, we don't \n cater to rough-looking \n customers like that.
Then do you know a place \n that would?
A place that sells the \n cheap stuff, I'd \n imagine.

Most of the places 
 around here fit that 
 pattern. We're an 
 exception.
Okay, I'll try one of \n them then.
You saw them by the plaza fountain? Thanks a lot!
Guess I'll keep checking around.
Seen these guys before?
Huh? Did you call me?
Yeah! I heard you were \n looking for the Angry \n Cenimapedes.
My sister knows where \n the Cenimapedes are.
Really!? Where?
Ask her. She's over \n there.
So you saw them by the fountain huh?
It's okay, I'll ask someone else.
Have you seen them before?
How familiar are you \n with the man you were \n just talking to?
I hate to say this but, \n you know he's a thief, \n right?
What are you goin' on \n about?
You better watch what \n you say about other \n people!
I think if anything, \n he's suspicious of me \n now...
Oh shoot, he's getting \n away!
Sorry, my mistake. I've \n gotta run!
You saw them in this plaza? Thanks!
No? Okay, I'll check with someone else then.
You've seen 'em around that island? Thanks!
What's the big idea \n askin' around about us?
Think you're so smart... \n You fell right into our \n trap.
Were those girls \n working for the \n Angry Centipede?
Alright, you found us. \n So state your business.
What's the matter, \n cat got your tongue?
Come on, out with it. \n You talk, maybe we'll go \n easy on you.
They talk big for \n a bunch of thieves...
Too bad I won't be going \n easy on you!
What!?
Over on that island, huh? Thank you!
So you saw them over on that island? Got it!
You've seen them around the bars here? Got it!
So they're usually near the bars, not the stalls?
The place with the pink awning, you say? Thanks!
I should ask the people in the plaza here if they've seen them.
They're not fond of fancy places, got it.
Thanks anyway, I'll keep asking around.
I should head over there and ask around.
Stay away \n from them!
OW!
Leave!
Oppressor!
Thief!
M-Me!?
He's the thief!
The Angry Centipede \n are just takin' back \n what's rightfully ours!
The rich won't \n miss it!
Without the \n Angry Centipede's \n help, we'd starve.
We're just doin' \n what we need to \n to survive.
Mummy, I'm hungry. \n Can we eat yet?
Th-This is...
It's, it's...
Citizens!
Hand over the \n stolen goods!
If you don't comply, \n we'll have to use force!
I repeat! Take them down!
Stop!
The soldiers are \n retreating!
Yeah, never thought I'd \n live to see the day.
It feels great to be on \n the winning side for a \n change!
Thank you for your help, \n miss.
No problem, I couldn't \n stand by and let them do \n that to you.
I'm sorry I misjudged \n you.

Well, you didn't 
 misjudge us, we did 
 steal that cargo from 
 Sun Shipping.
You must've had your \n reasons, care to \n explain?
The Angry Centipede were saviors to Jirga Para Lhao's poor. \n And the Garrison's soldiers, who were supposed to keep the peace, \n were keeping it at a high cost...
We recovered Vogo's missing cargo, \n but I couldn't bear to watch it being handed over.
Actually...
I have a little extra \n something for you...
Well, you were cutting it \n a bit close on time, but...
Shipment approved. \n Watches can be so unreliable.
Stupid \n Council...
Oh!
Shh...
Wow! \n Look at all this ore!
Mummy! \n Can we eat now?
Whoa...
Hehe...
I couldn't think of a better way \n to spend my hard-earned ore.
Thanks to the tax hike, \n we're losing money \n instead of making it!
Kat, y-you gave all \n your ore away? \n Really?
Yeah, well, I can always \n go get more, right?
You're so generous. \n And strong!
Well...
Or she doesn't \n think ahead.
Hmph.
I don't get it! \n Why do the people of Banga \n and Jirga's put up with this?
They're made to do all of \n the dangerous work but \n have nothing to show for it!
Even Vogo bows to the Council \n like an idiot instead of telling \n them what's on his mind!

*Sigh* I wasn't going 
 to say anything after you 
 covered me today, but... 
 Are you insane!?
Stop poking your \n nose in things \n you don't understand!
Vogo's right. \n We can't feed our \n families on ideals.
And we don't have anything \n to spare for handouts.

Lisa, you too? You're always 
 going on about how proud the 
 Lhao Tribe is. How can you 
 live like this?
What do you know!?
Pride's not going to \n fill our stomachs!
And if we argue or fight back, \n things just get made worse!

Jirga Para Lhao boasted the most wondrous riches 
 in the world and the most appalling living 
 conditions for its poor. I couldn't contain my 
 anger at the injustice I saw before me...
Uhm, I heard you know something about the Angry Centipede...
Woman: \n Over there...
That's the centipede logo! Thanks lady!
Guess I'd better head down then.

Okay, I'll keep asking around.

Is this Elgona?

I need to ask around Elgona for his whereabouts.
Follow the Angry \n Centipede Member
Lost him...
Angry Centipede Member: \n Hey! How's everythin' going lately?
He doesn't have anything, so where's the cargo...?
Where did he take it...?
I better keep my distance while I follow him.
Where's he going?
I hope he leads me to the cargo.
He seems nervous...
Maybe he's heading to some secret meeting?
They seemed to know each other. What were they talking about?
These people don't seem to notice that thief strolling around.
Maybe I should warn them after I get the cargo back?
Wow, he really is nervous.
We're getting close now, I can feel it.
Maybe it's a secret hideout or something.
I just hope Vogo's cargo is there.
Uh-oh! He's gonna spot me!
Phew, that was too close.

Shoot, he noticed me.
Oh no!
Spotted...
I'm losing him!
I need to stick closer to him.
Angry Centipede Member: \n Huh?
Angry Centipede Member: \n Is someone following me?
Angry Centipede Member: \n Must be my imagination.
Phew, that was a close one.
Angry Centipede Member: \n Nah... Who would follow me?
Need to avoid eye contact...
Angry Centipede Member: \n What are you doin!?
There's another one of them! It's time to pounce.
Elgona Resident: \n Hey, it's been a while, what have you been up to?
Angry Centipede Member: \n Just had to take care of some stuff in town.
Angry Centipede Member: \n Oh! I forgot I had something I need to do. Talk to you later.
Defeat the Angry Centipede
This has to be their hideout!
Angry Centipede Member: \n Wha-!? Who are you!?
I'm surrounded!
Drive Off the Garrison Soldiers
Garrison Commander: \n Fall-
Garrison Commander: \n Fall back!
More soldiers!

I need to take them out...
I don't think it's this way...
I've gotta do something about them!

Hm? Did I hear something?

Never mind... I'm 
 uh busy here with 
 inventory. Busy, 
 busy, busy...
